Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Category: SCARAB, SEAL, SCARABOID, INTAGLIO AND SIMILAR OBJECTS
Name: Object in the shape of a cowry shell
Description: Oval object in the shape of a cowry shell. The edges of the upper surface bear small incisions representing the jagged edge of the shell. The flat surface bears an interlaced motif, much appreciated during the Middle Kingdom.
